title: President appoints advisory group on multilateral engagement, debt sustainability
body_lines: President Gotabaya Rajapaksa has appointed a Presidential Advisory Group on Multilateral Engagement and Debt Sustainability.

Former Central Bank governor Dr. Indrajit Coomaraswamy, former chief economist of the World Bank Prof. Shanta Devarajan and former director of the IMF’s Institute of Capacity Development Dr. Sharmini Coorey will serve as the members of the said advisory group.

According to the President’s Media Division (PMD), the panel is expected to engage in discussions with relevant Sri Lankan institutions and officials engaging with the International Monetary Fund (IMF).
It is also tasked with providing guidance to address the present debt crisis.
